intro: Pitardella sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim pitardella, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous areas, thriving in cool and moist environments. It produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude habitats.
